stem: Select the two correct statements about Cloud Logging.
options/0/title: Cloud Logging lets you view logs from your applications and filter and search on them.
options/1/title: Cloud Logging requires you to store your logs in BigQuery or Cloud Storage.
options/2/title: Cloud Logging requires the use of a third-party monitoring agent.
options/3/title: Cloud Logging lets you define uptime checks.
options/4/title: Cloud Logging lets you define metrics based on your logs.

stem: There are “Four Golden Signals” that measure a system’s performance and reliability. What are they?
options/0/rationale: Review the lecture "Measuring performance and reliability."
options/1/rationale: Review the lecture "Measuring performance and reliability."
options/2/rationale: Review the lecture "Measuring performance and reliability."

stem: Which option describes a commitment made to your customers that your systems and applications will have only a certain amount of “downtime”?
options/1/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."
options/2/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."
options/3/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."

stem: Which definition best describes a service level indicator (SLI)?
options/0/title: A time-bound measurable attribute of a service
options/1/title: A contract with your customers regarding service performance
options/1/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."
options/2/title: A key performance indicator; for example, clicks per session or customer signups
options/2/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."
options/3/title: A percentage goal of a measure you intend your service to achieve
options/3/rationale: Review the lecture "Understanding SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs."

stem: You want to create alerts on your Google Cloud resources, such as when health checks fail. Which is the best Google Cloud product to use?
